intro: Coryphantha sneedii var. albicolumnaria, commonly known as the white-columned hedgehog cactus, is a unique species native to the Chihuahuan Desert in Mexico. It is characterized by its spiny, cylindrical stems that are often covered in a layer of white, waxy hairs, giving it a distinct appearance. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the spring and summer months, adding a splash of color to its arid habitat. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions with minimal water requirements. Due to its specific habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
